entry.title: Pashinyan backs dropping independence declaration reference from Constitution

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan backs dropping independence declaration reference from Constitution
media:group.media:description:
๐ Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan announced that Armenia is hopeful for a positive outcome regarding the European Union Peace Facilityโs proposal to allocate โฌ20 million to the country this year. ๐ Amid ongoing pressure from Azerbaijan to amend Armeniaโs Constitution, Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan said yesterday that in his view, the new draft should not include a reference to the 1990 Declaration of Independence. This exact constitutional change is part of Azerbaijanโs demands ahead of the potential signing of a normalization deal between the nations. ๐ Vardan Ghukasyan, a mayoral candidate nominated by the Armenian Communist Party, was elected mayor of Gyumri. ๐ OPINION | Armenian-Iranian drills send strategic signal amid regional volatility: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/945310/opinion-armenian-iranian-drills-send-strategic-signal-amid-regional-volatility/

entry.title: Iran, Turkey, and Azerbaijanโs opposing paths on political Islam

media:group.media:title: Iran, Turkey, and Azerbaijanโs opposing paths on political Islam
media:group.media:description:
In this in-depth interview, internationally renowned expert on the Middle East, Gilles Kepel, explores the complex dynamics of political Islam. He evaluates the future of Iranโs regime in the face of internal struggles and international pressure, and considers what might be a fracture in the close alliance between Turkey and Azerbaijan amid their diverging political-religious paths.

media:group.media:description:
ิตีฉีฅ ีซีถีฑ ีฏีกีด ีซีด ีจีถีฟีกีถีซึีซีฝ ีกีถีคีกีดีถีฅึีซีถ ีธึึีง ีขีกีถ ีบีกีฟีกีฐีซ, ีกีทีญีกึีฐีซ ีขีธีฌีธึ ีบีฅีฟีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐีถีฅึีซีถ ีกีตีค ีกีถีฑีซ ีพีฅึีกีขีฅึีตีกีฌ ึีกีฝีฟีกีฉีฒีฉีฅึ ีฏีธึีฒีกึีฏีพีฅีถ. ีฐีกีตีฟีกึีกึีฅึ ิณีตีธึีดึีซีซ ีถีธึีจีถีฟีซึ ึีกีฒีกึีกีบีฅีฟ ีีกึีคีกีถ ีีธึีฏีกีฝีตีกีถีจ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ิฑึีทีกีฌีธึีตีฝ ีีฒีคีฅีฝีตีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฐีกึึีกีฆึีธึีตึีธึีดึ ีีกึีคีกีถ ีีธึีฏีกีฝีตีกีถีจ ีบีกีฟีกีฝีญีกีถีฅึ ีกีตีถ ีฐีกึึีซีถ, ีฉีฅ ีกึีคีตีธึ ีกีตีฝึ ึ ีฝีบีกีผีถีกีฌีซึ ีฟีฅีฝีถีธีึีด ีง ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีฅึึีธึีค ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐ ีีฅึีช ีีกึีฃีฝีตีกีถีซึ, ีธึีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีกีถึีตีกีฌีธึีด ีฅีฒีฅีฌ ีฅีถ ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีคีกีทีถีกีฏีซึีถีฅึึ
0:00 - ิฑีถีธีถีฝ 0:52 - ีีฏีซีฆีข, ีพีฅึีกีคีกึีฑ 13 ีฟีกึีซ ีกีถึ 1:50 - ิฟึีซีดีซีถีกีฌีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีกีผีถีนีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 3:07 - ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีธึีด ีฏึีซีดีซีถีกีฌ ีนีฏีก, ีคีก ีพีฅึึีธึีด ีง 6:07 - ีีกึีฟีธึีถ ิณึีซีฃีธึีตีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฐีกึีกีขีฅึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึ, ีกึีตีกีถ ึ ีฉีทีถีกีดีกีถึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 7:58 โ ยซิตีฝ ีีกึีฟีธึีถ ิณึีซีฃีธึีตีกีถีซ ีฌีกีพีถ ีฅีด ึีกีถีฏีกีถีธึีดยป 8:33 โ ิณีตีธึีดึีซีธึีด ีฏึีซีดีซีถีกีีฌีถ ีง ีซีทีญีฅีฌีธึ 10:27 โ ีึีฅีถึีธีพ ีฃีธีฒีฅึีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฐีกึีกีขีฅึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 12:00 โ ีีิฟ, ิฒีิฟ ึ ิฟีธีดีฏีธึีฝ. ีีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีฟึีกีถีฝึีฅึีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 14:56 โ ีีกึีคีกีถ ีีธึีฏีกีฝีตีกีถ` ึีธึึีกีดีกีฝีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ ึีกีฒีกึีกีบีฅีฟ 17:05 โ ีีฅึีช ีีกึีฃีฝีตีกีถีซีถ ีฐีกึีธีฒ ีธึีชีฅึีซึ ีฝีฟีกึีกีฎ ีกีปีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 19:01 โ ีีฅึีช ีึีกีฃีฝีตีกีถีซึ ีพีฟีกีถีฃีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 21:32 โ ีีกึีคีกีถ ีีธึีฏีกีฝีตีกีถีจ` ีซึ ีถีฏีกีฟีดีกีดีข ีดีกีฐีกึีธึีฑีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 22:44 โ ีีบีกีฝีพีธีฒ ีฏีกีคึีกีตีซีถ ึีธึีธีญีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 23:35 โ ิณีตีธึีดึีซีซ ีขีตีธึีปีฅีซ ีกีพีฅีฌีกึีดีกีถ ีกีฒีขีตีธึึีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 26:54 โ ยซิตีฝ ีฏีกีผีกีพีกึีธึีฉีตีกีถีจ ีคีกีฟีซ ีฏีฟีกีดยป 27:28 โ ยซิตีฝ ีฏีฃีถีกีด-ีฏีคีซีดีกีพีธึีฅีด ีพีกึีนีกีบีฅีฟีซีถ... ยป 28:53 โ ยซีีฅีฆ ีฏีกึีธีีฒ ีฅีถ ีฑึีขีกีฏีกีฌีฅีฌยป, - ีฐีกึึ` ีีกึีคีกีถ ีีธึีฏีกีฝีตีกีถีซีถ 29:52 โ ีีซึีกีตีฅีฌ ีกึึ. ิฑีปีกีบีกีฐีตีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฐีกึีกีขีฅึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ

entry.title: In rare speech, Serzh Sargsyan rebukes Pashinyan and calls for change

media:group.media:title: In rare speech, Serzh Sargsyan rebukes Pashinyan and calls for change
media:group.media:description:
๐ Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan has proposed that Armenia and Azerbaijan sign a peace treaty and simultaneously request the formal dissolution of the OSCE Minsk Group. ๐ Hungary has blocked an EU defense aid package for Armenia for six weeks, highlighting tensions within the bloc and Budapestโs continued alignment with Russia and Azerbaijan. ๐ In a rare public address, former President Serzh Sargsyan sharply criticized Armeniaโs leadership over the loss of Artsakh and outlined his partyโs vision for restoring national strength and unity. ๐Armenia reports progress in talks over airport expansion: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RVlVJvyu1AU

entry.title: Armeniaโs ice hockey team victorious in second consecutive game

media:group.media:title: Armeniaโs ice hockey team victorious in second consecutive game
media:group.media:description:
Armeniaโs national ice hockey team clinches a 3-2 shootout victory in a neck-and-neck game against Uzbekistan on April 14, the second day of the International Ice Hockey Federation World Championship, Division IV.
The tightly-contested match saw two goals scored from each team in the second period, with no goals in the first and third periods. After a goalless overtime, the teams went straight into a thrilling shootout, with Armenia winning by a score of two goals to one.
Prior to the match, Armeniaโs head coach Vadim Guskov said that on paper Uzbekistanโs team is a cut above the rest, making this victory particularly significant for Armenia.
